sentence: BlackBerry BBRY CEO John Chen announced today that the company's new "Priv" phone will be heading to Verizon VZ , T-Mobile TMUS , and Sprint S .
Blackberry originally entered into a 60-day exclusivity agreement with AT&T T , which began shipping the device in November of last year.

While Chen did not announce specific availability dates, T-Mobile CEO John Legere tweeted during BlackBerry's press conference that the Priv would be available from his company starting on January 26 th .
This news seems to confirm that BlackBerry intends to stay in the hardware business for at least the near future.
Chen, who is entering year three of his three-year plan to turn the company around, previously hinted that BlackBerry may leave the mobile device scene entirely.
BlackBerry has recently found success with its new BES12 software platform, which is gaining traction at the corporate level.
A focus on enterprise software has paid off for other tech companies recently, including the "MAGS," or Microsoft MSFT , Amazon AMZN , Google GOOGL , and Salesforce CRM , cloud computing leaders.
Nevertheless, BlackBerry is seeing renewed interest in its hardware thanks to the Priv device.
Unlike previous BlackBerry phones, Priv runs on the incredibly popular Android operating system.
It also offers additional software technology and features that other Android devices don't have.
Currently, BlackBerry is a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy).
Today's news confirms that the Priv will be expanding to all of the major mobile providers, and renewed focus on software should also help BlackBerry investors in 2016.
